Bp-Hqpibyhq3axcEq5nfHg.text: Drinks were admittedly pretty good -- wouldn't recommend going for food though. I got the ceviche and it was overly acidic and not st all satisfying. Bf got the wings and was similarly unimpressed. Interesting ambiance though. Fun tiki vibe in an unlikely setting.

qGk4Aw6Mep6Y_Fqjy7HV0g.text: Went during the happy hour with a friend. We were seated immediately and the place wasn't too full since it was still quite early. We ordered happy hour cocktails which are half-off and were quite delicious. They also have an extensive menu of cocktails, that come in fun shapes utensils. The menu itself is quite small with classic Caribbean items, perfect for two people. We ordered the plantain appetizer and the jerk chicken wings for appetizers and the rice and beans with chicken for main course which we split between the two of us. The plates are small, however we were quite full by the end of it that we had to forgo dessert. The plantains were decent and tasted good with the topping. The jerk wings were not my favorite and were only moderately spicy, but were cooked well. The rice and beans was flavourfull and I quite enjoyed it.  I quite liked the ambience of the place and the interiors follow a Caribbean theme. Ideal for a casual date night. The waitress was friendly too.

WTq92yWX1kbKmFLteMBxxA.text: Great drinks, food and service in a fun atmosphere. Hidden Harbor is must-try unique experience in Pittsburgh.   When I first heard of Hidden Harbor I thought "Why would someone open a tiki bar in Squirrel Hill?" But my visits have shown it to be the perfect addition to the area.   The staff is fantastic. Friendly, knowledgeable and incredibly attentive. I love that everyone seems to really know the ins and outs of their menu and how their signature cocktails are made. Our waitress recommended the Tropical Itch and the Gardenia Grog - both of which were fantastic.  You might expect that a place like Hidden Harbor would concentrate only on drinks and let the food be so-so. But this isn't the case. Hidden Harbor has a fantastic small menu. We had the Shrimp Ceviche and the Plantain Canoa. The Ceviche was fresh, lite and satisfying. The Canoa was a delicious blend of meat and savory plantain. My only gripe was with the plantain chips for the Ceviche - I was hoping for something crispier, while these were somewhat soft.   Go here by yourself and sit at the bar or go with friends and share some of their multi-person drinks. Happy drinking!

or0DVUgLaXbka-JifiCbCA.text: This place is amazing!  They make the best cocktails in Pittsburgh hands down!  I don't think there is a close second. Check out Time Machine Treasure Map Tuesdays for a unique menu of classic Tiki cocktails that normally aren't on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Missionary&#39;s Downfall from the fall 2018 Time Machine Treasure Map
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Queen&#39;s Park Swizzle
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Aku-Aku Zombie from the time machine menu exclusively on Tuesday&#39;s oct-dec 2018

h6Bg58erb7rIBIhg_m6X1w.text: I gave Hidden Harbor a second shot, and I have to also give it another star since it was definitely better than my last visit. The decor itself is truly at least 4-star worthy; cute string lights and lots of greenery and plants, a cozy lounge area, and a deep commitment to tiki-inspired prints really added to the ambiance. I still found the prices to be a little high, and probably won't add it to my regular bar rounds, but maybe on a really chilly winter night I'll stop back in for some tropical vibes.

eBnCPLLBJ8aJu47IBlN6dg.text: Really enjoyed this place. Super cool and unique, but not tacky. Drinks were detail oriented, well prepared, and tasty. In terms of food, I only had a meatball appetizer to hold me over for dinner, but with that said --  really good. I thought the place was also very clean and had the feel of a high-end restaurant. Id definitely return for the full dinner experience, but also a great place to stop in and grab drink. Happy hour from 5-6pm!

5PpPM9ujkauTBNCkvhJcbQ.text: This place literally is a hidden harbor in Squirrel Hill. Last week I met up with some friends to celebrate one of their birthdays--it was pouring outside and stepping into this cozy little tiki style bar was almost magical. Initially the 8 of us had to crowd around a small table, but we were lucky enough that one of two large seating areas opened up and we were able to sit together in a big booth. The lighting on the ceiling and the decor provides the perfect atmosphere to enjoy some really fun and creative (if overpriced) drinks. I don't drink alcohol, but they had a few creative mocktails so I didn't feel left out of the experience. The staff were very friendly and accommodating, and we had a great night! Definitely would not mind going back in the near future :)

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The Riptide (mocktail)

t4pIrkuEzpvxzt2ka2qeCw.text: Okay, I LOVE this place! I'm so happy they put a spot like this in the area - I feel like it's been a long time coming. The vibe is so fun! It's a great place to come with a group of friends or for a date night. There are a TON of drink selections, each with a beach theme. The drinks don't disappoint - neither does the atmosphere. I definitely recommend stopping in here if you get a chance!  We came on a Saturday night. It was busy, but luckily three seats were open at the bar the second we walked in.

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

NDvcYVZkemNNBHTnFJdOUg.text: A great addition to squirrel hill! Hidden harbor has delicious drinks and fantastic food.   The tripleta sandwich was great and flavorful, and the plantain chips were fantastic. The sauce on the side was so so good.   The drinks are much more affordable during happy hour and I like that they tell you how much alcohol to expect in your drinks.

dSRjq8cspjbY6geeGPkwYQ.text: We came here for happy hour on Friday night and as usual the drinks were great! The happy hour only runs from 5-6, so be sure to get here early. My husband loves their painkillers, so he got 2 of those! My favorite is Don's special daiquiri with Maggie's farm rum. I also got the Queen's Park swizzle which was really good.  I took off 1 star because I wish the service was a little bit better. We were sitting outside and the service just isn't quite as seamless as it feels like it should be, but no issues that would keep us from coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Knitting at happy hour with painkiller and Don&#39;s special daiquiri
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Painkiller and Queen&#39;s Park sizzle

2yJpBdz70slIBOJz9yHq-w.text: I have been here 3 times. The first time I had dinner here, which I would not recommend, and the second time I sat at the bar, which I would definitely recommend!  It's a lot of fun to watch the bartenders make these very elaborate drinks. We saw the bartender make one in this beautiful fish glass. We kept looking through the menu trying to figure out what drink it was. Eventually the bartender overheard our conversation and told us it's called "Tokoyo Drift", and it's not on the menu anymore, but offered to make one for us anyway! It was awesome, complete with little pop boba as "caviar"  I can't give this place 5 stars because I did not particularly like the food here, and I feel like most of the drinks are either very strong or very sweet, and I wish they had some lighter/clean options (think rum and coke v. gin and tonic). If you like tiki-bar style drinks then you'll love this place. It's just not really my kind of drink. I also find it frustrating that they are closed Sundays and mondays

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The &#34;Tokyo Drift&#34;. Not on the menu anymore, but if you ask nicely they might make it anyway!

FMxeZDsm3HZi_ZynIvx_tA.text: Stopped by on a weekday for a quick happy hour experience with my friends. Everywhere around the space there's tiki themed decorations, and I found myself just looking around a lot. This place definitely has their teal-colored tropical tiki style branding down. The space isn't large, and it was definitely filling up as Happy Hour came to a close. However there was plenty of seating at the beginning, so I would recommend coming in a little earlier if you can!  We were slightly hungry, so we ordered the nachos to start. With the curried meat add-on it was a generous portion that was the perfect size as a snack for the four of us, but could have been a meal for one. We also saw poke and tacos on the food menu, which I definitely want to try out sometime.  For happy hour, Hidden Harbor has a specific cocktails menu with half priced drinks. We probably tried at least half of the cocktails on it, and none of them disappointed! I appreciated how a lot of them had nice garnishes which made them visually appealing on top of being delicious.   Service was very nice! I slid in an order for a drink 5 minutes before Happy Hour ended, and saw that it was charged full price on my receipt. I asked the server if I could get that changed, and they gave me a new receipt without a hitch.

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Cute flower garnish
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Happy Hour drinks and a bowl of nachos!

XUCL5XQmqq_sK_yJTP75Rw.text: This is such a cool spot! Want a tropical getaway but can't make the trip? Here's your place to fulfill your tiki needs.   Our first try here on a Saturday evening there was a wait. No worries. The nice hostess took our number and we walked next door for a drink. We got a phone call about 20 minutes later that a table was ready for us.  They go all out here with the cocktails. I love that the menu also includes a drawing of what the drink looks like (including the glass). I started with a Gardenia Grog (gin, rhum agricole, Jamaican rum, lemon, raspberry, lavender, lemongrass, vanilla, cantaloupe, pineapple, bitters, rose water). It came complete with a straw encapsulated in ice (I dunno if I'm explaining this right. It almost looked like a rock candy stick).   Loved the vibe, the atmosphere, and the people.

s-IRrwU4AeOI_JeGrJCNBw.text: Great atmosphere! Happy hour was a great deal and it is in a nice location so you can hop next door and have a happy hour at Independent Brewing, too!

YiP-RC3_YUdzj9eaOlxvxQ.text: I love the island theme here. I got Pina Colada to fit the theme and the drink was amazing! I love sweet cocktails so I'll totes come back soon for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pina Colada Taco

e4OUkWqNIKhiIAuRi-zqPw.text: Recently went for the first time-- overall I was not impressed. The decor was fine which is why this is a 2-star review. Upon sitting down (at about midnight), the first thing our waitress did was abruptly tell us last call is at 1230. I found this odd for a bar, but that's the decision of the business owner. We ordered some drinks which were OK, but certainly nothing special. We attempted to order another round while working on those, so we could fit in a second before last call. We were told that we could not as we still had drinks.   I heard her reference a group of people and say "this whole side is very intoxicated," but we couldn't figure out who she meant. It was obvious the group she referred to was not overly intoxicated and were bewildered by her statement. It was very obvious she just wanted the night to be over and wanted to not have to serve anyone else.   Well- mission accomplished!  You have ensured that you will never serve me again as I have no plans to return.

1Jif5J_JeWJlH2S82Pd4Uw.text: Very friendly service, great food, and awesome drinks. My wife and I loved the decorative drinks! We actually had no idea that this place even existed but are happy we found it. It actually felt like we weren't in Pittsburgh when we walked in. Love Pittsburgh but thought that was funny!

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Q3S7y4cZtazlZrZ513zc9g.text: It's five o'clock somewhere, right? Why not check out a great happy hour spot?   Hidden Harbor is an island hideaway right in the 'Burgh's backyard. Located right on Shady Avenue in Squirrel Hill, you'll find a cozy tiki lover's dream. With an island ambiance and tropic-cool music, you'll feel like you're on a mini vacation.   The drinks are delicious--not too strong and not too sweet. They're just enough to take the edge off of a long week. We've had the mai tai, daiquiri and eastern sour from the happy hour menu along with a Freddy Fugu to share.   Another reviewer mentioned an issue with ice, and I wanted to offer clarification. Many of the cocktails are served in a glass of chewable style ice (think pellets). Daiquiris are served in a smaller glass with no ice. Drinks are a little steep outside of happy hour, admittedly, but for $5-$6 during those magic hours, a cold and refreshing cocktail will be mai fine.   As far as food goes, we tried the Jamaican jerk wings. They were a bit on the salty side, and while wings, but they were still tasty. Four whole wings for $6.   Sorry for the puns. Seriously, check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Eastern sour
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Saturn gin cocktail
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Don&#39;s Daiquiri and an Eastern Sour

O1aewL2ShUOxO7gKtSLMCg.text: I went to Hidden Harbor the other day for my daughter in-laws birthday. I had never been there before and to be honest I am not much of a drinker. we called ahead and reserved a table for 6. we where seated immediately and a waitress came over immediately. I had the trader vicks mai tai. The drink was ok not much to speak about and definetly nothing special , About 3/4 of the glass was ice. I found the service to be excellent and the decor and theme was nice. First negative was I was expecting the place to be cool and to sit in a nice relaxing temperature. Instead it was really hot and not comfortable at all. second negative the drinks are small in size and way to much ice especially for the cost of the drinks which are any where from 12-16 dollars each. 3rd negative food selection extremely limited and for me nothing I would want to eat. Although they say they will make anything as it is a bar obviously the selection of standard specialty drinks are very limited. I am being generous in saying they deserve no more than 2 stars and that is only because the service was so good otherwise I would have given them one star. As a very limited drinker and someone who is happy drinking a beer I can not recommend Hidden Harbor as to me it was way over priced and not to my liking. If you want a fancy expensive drink with mostly ice and a very limited menu then Hidden Harbor is for you.

Hidden Harbor's happy hour is Tuesday-Friday from 5-6pm.  They have 8 tropical drinks that are 1/2 off making them about $5 or $6.  The drinks are beautiful, tasty, and strong! I was really happy with my first experience at Hidden Harbor and I will definitely be back!

1sfApbcOQg0R76DLVI8xQQ.text: Great little gem in Squirrel Hill on Shady Ave. Quaint little Tiki Bar with very friendly bartenders and wait staff. Two sections consisting of a bar with about 10 seats, with about 4 little tables and an adjoining dining area. It has all the feel of the Islands with all the island drinks in the Tiki glasses of which you can purchase. Small little menu, just enough of a small plate variety. I got the Empinada, deep fried, with a meat sauce, topped with a salsa verse, and a creme' fresh on top, delicious, and just enough of a portion. Of course I saw a Tres Leches cake for dessert, and yes I ordered a piece. So yummy, moist cake topped with toasted coconut, a mango sauce, and a whipped topping. Great food, great service, and yes I had a Hidden Harbor Zombie for an adult beverage, soooo good! All presented beautifully with flowers and a tiki stir. I'll be back for sure.....

dePQz4IhjSl29_bXPgpwiA.text: I never thought that I would give this place a two star review. To be honest, I'm torn between giving one and two stars....  The host, and waitress were extremely kind. However, our dining experience was awful to say the least. First, I love the tiki concept... the decor is very tribal and unique... the drinks as well, from approx $12-$14 each you get a tiny drink that comes of course with flowers, sharks, umbrellas, all the fixins! Pretty, sure! However, after I drank one tropical drink I was wanting to switch to white wine. Their menu says that they have Chardonnay, but the waitress explained that they only carried one white wine at a time, and tonight's was Pinot Grigio. The only other white, sparkling Brut. Ok, so I ordered it. And for $10 I received the tiniest glass, really disappointed in that!   We ordered the plantain nachos. After about 40 minutes waiting for them it was clear that they had forgotten about our order. When we asked about the nachos, the waitress seemed surprised that we didn't get them. About 15 minutes later she brought out regular nachos and explained that they had ran out of plantains...... "but  don't worry, they're free" she said. Ok, great! I'm really never complaining about free food. However; I do complain about free food that isn't even really the food we ordered.   To top it off, my water had an odd smell all evening and then I noticed the source... the moldy flip cap that was on our table, and what we poured our water from.   Thumbs down, Hidden Harbor! I would be apprehensive to come back, or recommend this place to anyone. Which bums me out because Lorelei is one of my favorite bars in the city (east liberty) and they have the same owners.

TLjpOjxz6uIU4oozO4UUkA.text: Tiki bars are always so much fun. Even the ones that aren't as nice as others can be a blast (if you drink enough Zombies).  I've been to many tiki bars across the country and Hidden Harbor is a primo space really doing justice to the movement.  They offer an incredibly tasty selection of food but come on we all know it's about the booze.  The cocktail prices are average for this type of establishment.  They offer traditional tiki drinks as well as tiki drinks with a twist if you will.  I've never had a bad drink here but that could be that I've been so drunk is not know the difference. All kidding aside, the drinks here are stellar. Strong and stellar.  I'm a sucker for a paper umbrella, plastic shark and a fancy bowl to drink from. I walk through the door and shout, "take my money, please!"  As you all know it's easy to get drunk quickly at this type of watering hole so pace yourselves.

H28ZuDn0HHIpnboPaY0MtQ.text: Hidden Harbor is a fun and cute place to stop by for a drink. I went there on a Thursday night with a few friends. One friend ordered a mock tail. My other friends and I ordered drinks that were labeled as "extra potent" on the menu and they were good. Drinks cost between $11-$15, which is what I would expect to pay at a themed bar like this. GRsuGVuSulCFRSZrHD9E7A.text: Hidden Harbor had been hyped up to me over the past couple years since it had opened. Despite a sore throat and a long business dinner on the other side of town, I was able to squeeze in a trip to the tropical bar at last.   For some reason, it didn't look anything like I had expected it to. It seemed cozier than I had expected. The decor seemed more grandiose in photos, but they managed to make the vibe still intimate. For example, they have the giant tiki statue with fake foliage around it, making the place look a little intense. Once you are actually in front of the statue, you see its surrounded by little nooks for drinking and chatting.   I chose to sit at the bar, because that's where you get a real feel for a bar program. My first drink came out in one of their custom mugs, which is a Tiki Bob in a shark outfit with a cheetah print. Yes you read that right. I was relatively pleased with the drink, but quite disappointed that they were sold out of the mug. This mug seemed to embody everything I want in a tiki bar, a nod to the past but a playful modern take on tiki. My attention was directed to a rack of retired custom mugs behind the bar with similar creations. I'll be keeping my eye out should one come up on a second hand market.   Over the next couple hours, I tried in total of about 5 drinks (including one of their non-alcoholic ones.) All of the drinks were very good, but didn't quite blow me away. I appreciated the variety of drinking vessels and the garnish game was flamboyant enough to satisfy the tiki nerd in me. I didn't eat any food considering I had just come from dinner elsewhere, but I was impressed by the menu items I saw being brought out. I had never seen mofongo on a tiki bar menu. I respect the new take on the edible front for a tiki spot.    What perhaps made the biggest impression on me at Hidden Harbor were the people who worked there. While making drinks is a very important part being a bartender, it's also about serving and dealing with their customers. Not only were the staff super attentive and hospitable to me and other patrons, I saw them handling a few "situations" in a very classy and controlled manner. I got the impression that a wide variety of people feel very comfortable coming into Hidden Harbor which makes me believe they have a fair amount of regulars. I don't know when I will be back in the 'Burgh, but I know for sure Hidden Harbor will be at the top of my list of places to visit.

j7H5HeI7cEvzhqQVtLjIDA.text: I always love coming here for the chill environment and the drinks. I would say the food is a bit pricey but I enjoy the unique and good flavors. The first time I got food here, I got their banh mi special and it was really good. This time, I ordered their Octopus Escabeche and it was delicious!   I ordered the Leaf & Bean drink and it was a bit strong for my tastes. I wasn't going to mention anything but when our waiter came and asked me how the drink was, I said it was strong and he kindly offered to switch drinks for me which was very nice of him to do. I switched it with the Rum Cannonball and I enjoyed that drink much more. It was sweeter and had just the right amount of alcohol.

cgXtQpoHEq1j0hSWgOjyTg.text: After a long day of work a few of my coworkers decided to make a trek from the downtown office to one of the hidden gems in Squirrel Hill. It was my first visit, and boy was I shocked at how great this place was. From the melo Island atmosphere to the tropical booth littered with comfy pillows. As we all had long days, we went through about 3 of these and it got better every time.

uM6qp1CRhYBoTFauLBANxQ.text: WHO knew you could take a mini mini vacation to the land of Tiki right here in Pittsburgh  I love this place they have a bar as well as tables we were so lucky and I truly mean this ... we sat at the end of the bar super fast service as the bar tender was right there in front of us making Hidden Harbors signature drinks I had a mock tail even had a vintage vibe shark stirrer and YES it did have a little paper umbrella thank for asking. gAEnhJQ8AxtenVCwin-0oA.text: Really fun bar to have a few drinks and bring a few friends to.  The bartenders are very friendly, knowledgeable, and are open to making any accommodations you want to ask for. They also really put on a show, so make sure to grab a bar seat to see the theatrics.  I know that the bar theme suits to having a lot of rum based drinks, but it would be nice to see some other style drinks featured as well.

3NC7PV-B-quJcZO5rdqS4w.text: Very cool restaurant! Full-on tiki bar with traditional Puerto Rican cuisine and delicious tropical drinks. I got the jaguar shark cocktail, which was huge and meant to be shared. Only $20, which was very reasonable for the size. The food was also very delicious and island-themed. A lot of plaintains, spiced meat, avocado, etc. The decor was very tiki and fun.   The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because they were out of rice, which is a pretty critical ingredient when the food is Puerto Rican. There aren't a ton of items on the menu so the lack of rice meant we couldn't get quite a few dishes we were interested in.

SLZNuABuvvSJjc5FKY5Z-Q.text: My husband and I have been wanting to come here for awhile but unfortunately had an off experience. We came in on Friday night and it was decently Crowded. We put our name on the list and the hostess said we were the only people on the list so it shouldn't be too long.  We made our way to the bar while we waited. The drink menu is SO COOL! There are so many fun, creative drinks. The atmosphere is beachy themed and really awesome. We were excited to be there! I honestly forget the name of the drinks we had, but the frozen one was so refreshing. I felt like I was on vacation! The bartender was doing such a great job making the drinks, however he would not speak a word to us after a few failed attempts.   A hour goes by and still no table. Then we see her seating people just walking in. We looked at the menu at the bar and it has like 7 things on it. I don't know if this is just the bar menu or the real menu, since we were never seated. At this point we called it a day. Our table was $43 for 3 cocktails and a beer so pretty pricey, however like I said they were really inventive drinks.  I'm hoping this was just a one off experience but it left a pretty bad taste in my mouth which is a bummer after looking forward to coming here for months.

1CfD5MExpe4Pq2Eibqffow.text: Finally able to make the trip from Erie to visit Hidden Harbor. It was everything I'd hoped for. Bartenders are extremely polite, efficient, and patient, and the cocktails they were creating were excellent. We tried a mix of their house cocktails and off menu classics, and we were pleased with each. The Gardenia Grog was surprisingly floral and pleasant. A complex drink they pull off very well. Their frozen drinks (Josie's & Blue Steel) have some very unique and pleasing flavors to them. To those complaining about the price of the drinks.... you don't know what you're talking about. From fresh juice, to house made syrups, to top shelf rums, to complex recipes (where if one ingredient is off the cocktail becomes an undrinkable mess) you're getting your money's worth. Try making any of these at home, and see how quickly you've spent over $100 on ingredients, assuming you can track down the proper rums in PA.  Didn't try any of the food, but what we saw looked tasty. Decor is modern with just enough of a retro tiki vibe. Music was in the background and suited the more more modern take of the bar. If there was any suggestion I'd make, it would be on future menus to explain a little better what's in the cocktails booze wise. The lady next to us was nursing a Curse of Pele for a while. She liked it, "but it's strong". She had no clue "navy strength" meant 114 proof rum, rather than the 80 proof she's probably used to in cocktails.  Looking forward to a return trip to here later this winter.

eB4K46zdjBc-N4VCYkBFzQ.text: I wish I could give a zero but 1 star is the lowest possible rating. I went for a second time because I wanted so bad for this place to be good latin restaurant, but all I got was even more disappointed. I ordered drinks from the bar and they where good, very pretty but very over priced. Then I ordered the octopus salad. Now I'm Puerto Rican and when I see octopus salad on the the menu of a Puerto Rican restaurant I am thinking that this salad would of had a lot of Latin Flavor. While the octopus was tender, the flavor was underwhelming. And my friend ordered the seviche with plantain chips. The seviche lacked everything that makes a seviche so wonderful. It had no spice no heat and was incredibly mediocre, plus the plantain chips where burnt. When our bartender  asked how our food was and we said not very good he literally replied with an "okay". It's very disappointing that's a Puerto Rican/Hawaiian restaurant has let me down twice, and to make matters worse the staff obviously is so arrogant because of the current hype that they don't care to make things right. They could least care that your customer is not happy with the meal and take that into consideration l. Definitely not going again!

UgLkpwc_80mlQlnqbMqqyQ.text: Great cocktails! The drinks are all works of art. Extremely cool atmosphere in the bar and great place for happy hour, too.

sqXvoM3IjVAd73rDveeWiw.text: Drinks are great and the inside has a really cool tiki/beach vibe. Food menu is a bit limited. However, we both had pokes, and they were delicious. Tacos we saw others eating looked really good.

3AAo4gZ3PT5EWwuQxUDPmQ.text: Hidden Harbor is really good. The drinks are fantastic and the menu is really well laid out. I've had consistently excellent service.  When you arrive, they offer menus almost immediately. I've only ever had a 15-20 minute wait for a table or space at the bar.  The drinks are well made and they have a nice selection of stronger and fruitier drinks. The menu is really self explanatory of giving you an idea of what you're getting. While most drinks are rum based, they have vodka and whiskey based items as well. It's a really nice mix.   If you can get a spot at the bar, I'd recommend it. I enjoy seeing all the different drinks made.   I haven't had the food, but it looks good.

Rso94wNyRcwkzg3dkq4Xqg.text: I really enjoyed the atmosphere at Hidden Harbor. I was able to sit outside with my date and take in fun vibe of squirrel hill. This was important to me because I work in an office all day and it's so nice to be outside.   We just ordered drinks and let me tell you, they are on the strong side! I ordered the Mai Thai (spelling?). It was quite delicious with the fresh lime wedge perched among the ice.   Our waiter was friendly and polite. The cocktails are so very pretty and they taste as good as they look.  The menu is limited and a bit pricey for such small portions - but the taste is quite good and it's advisable to eat some protein as you work your way through the drinks. BtzYq5rGDKgBnRKlkBLJnQ.text: They are coming up on their one year anniversary in January but this place is such a hidden gem. I love rum so I thought I'd stop in and check them out. I'm so glad I did I will certainly come back here on a regular basis. I have a Rum Passport so I need 20 stamps to fill it up. I currently have to stamps so there's work to do. The Rum Passport is a brilliant idea and fun for rum lovers. The variety is amazing this is an opportunity to try rum from all over the world. They also have mixed drink and shared drinks. This place is great for solo missions or groups they have something for everyone. The way they accent/garnish their drinks is nothing short of top notch. Reminds me of the details from the tv show Bar Rescue. I also had a mixed drink and appetite. The pork slider was delicious and the wait time was very short. Love quick service. The bartender explained everything to me and checked in regularly. My mixed drink reminded me of a Caribbean rum punch. Very tasty! The service was outstanding. The prices are fair and I feel the quality is worth it. Very clean amd safe environment. Parking lot nearby because parking in Squirrel Hill can be hit or miss. I highly recommend this place and look forward to my next visit.

hXYu-ujpJHoiQCuWBwWC0w.text: I stopped by Hidden Harbor last night with a good friend.  Having heard that there was a brand new tiki bar in Squirrel Hill (of all places!), I suggested we check it out.  My friend was game, and the weather was appropriately frigid, so we took the bus over so we could get a proper buzz on from island-themed drinks.  Upon arrival, we were enthusiastically greeted by the host, and were informed that no tables were available, but that we could hang out at the drink rail in the corner while awaiting one.  We decided to do that, so we hung out there while imbibing our first round of drinks: a fassionola fizz for me ($12) and an Ishmael for my friend ($11).  As the name might suggest, the fizz is a gin-based drink with fassionola (tropical fruit cordial), seltzer, and cream, and made for a light and refreshing start to the evening.  The Ishmael is a darker drink based on two types of rum that also includes fig, guava, and almond extract, and seemed quite stiff from the sip I tried.  Upon obtaining the drinks, after having been at the drink rail approx. 20 min, a table opened up and we were able to sit down.  Upon being seated, we decided to try the tuna tacos ($10).  For me, these were the letdown of the night, given that one order consisted of three tiny tacos, and I found them rather flavorless.  The seared tuna tasted like what I imagine cat food must taste like (bland and chewy) and the harissa aioli didn't add any kick--the only redeeming aspect was the falafel croutons.  After having consumed them and finished off our first round of drinks, we opted for a second round.  This time, I ordered the tropic thunder and my friend ordered the Josie's faraway vacation ($12 each).  In contrast to my first drink, the tropic thunder was a rum-based drink with various flavors, including bitters, absinthe, grapefruit, cinnamon, and lime.  To my surprise, the Josie's ended up being my favorite drink of the evening.  Also a rum-based drink, it contains coconut milk and cream, as well as basil and a hint of chili, and is served frozen, such that it tastes kind of like a mix between an alcoholic slushee and milkshake.  Had I ordered that drink, I can guarantee that it would have gone down *waaay* too smoothly and easily--so perhaps it's a good thing I didn't...  The ambiance was warm and had fun tiki-themed accents, including the wooden mask carvings that can be viewed in photos.  Service was pretty good, despite it being super crowded.  Given that they're currently in their soft opening phase, it's unclear whether the final menu will have the same items and whether the selection will be expanded.  I would hope that it ultimately includes some more substantial food offerings similar to its sister IBC next door--though the tuna tacos and the offerings there lead me to wonder whether they'd be similar in quality.  One additional thing worth noting is the poko-lulu drink, a bowl drink intended for sharing between 4 people, which seems quite popular based on my observation (disclaimer: you'll definitely need a ride home if you order it!).  If you're in the mood for something surprising and different, or just want to escape the depressing PGH winter weather, definitely be sure to check out this fun new addition to the Squirrel Hill community!

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ishmael
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fassionola fizz
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Soft opening menu

QOB_DIawvFfA_H-q4I4hsQ.text: Went here for date night with my hunny a few Friday's ago. Upon arrival, the bar and the seated area was packed so the hostess took our name and said it would be about an hour for a seat, but if any area at the bar opened up, it was fair game. We decided to wait because we were already out, so why not? I could not wait to order a drink because everyone's drinks around us looked amazing, and the presentation was so unique! The hostess saw a couple at the bar getting ready to leave, so she walked over to us and said that if we stood over by the couple getting ready to leave, then we could take their spots. (This was after about only 15 minutes of waiting. I thought that was super sweet of her to do that!) we settled in at the bar and right away, a bartender named Sarah greeted us with a smile and some menu's. I decided on the Tokyo Drift. I apologize, but I can't remember what my boyfriend ordered. The bartenders are entertaining to watch while they are making drinks. Sarah made our drinks by where we were sitting so we were able to watch her make them the whole time. I thought that was pretty cool! Just at first sight, my drink looked so neat! It was served in a literal gold fish, and it has a half of a lime (hollowed out serving as a bowl) with passion fruit boba's. Besides my drink looking super cool, it also tasted amazing. It was a cold February day, but sipping on my drink made me feel like I was on a beach somewhere in the Caribbean. We only had time to stay for one drink, but I can't wait to go back and try some other cocktails! I highly recommend trying out Hidden Harbor when you have the chance!

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tokyo Drift. Served in a gold fish with a lime and popping boba&#39;s. Get this drink.. You&#39;re welcome in advance for the recommendation ;)

EZAk1JXpUTsEg4mwmx26lw.text: Finally, a True Tiki bar in Pittsburgh. I made it my mission in life to visit all of the Tiki bars in the States and I can confidently say that this may just be right up there with Lost Lake in Chicago, Porco in Cleveland, a little bit of Frankie's Tiki from Vegas and a bit of Tolteca from New Orleans.  I have one negative-it is too bright sitting at the bar! Dim those lights!  Now onto the good stuff-the staff is super friendly, knowledgeable and efficient. The drinks take time to prepare (which they should!) and are prepared with great ingredients. The Ishmael and Hidden Harbor drinks were spectacular. I loved the ice sphere in the Hidden Harbor drink and the color was beautiful! Almost too pretty to drink. The Ishmael had several complex flavors such as clove infused rum, fig and almond extract. Take a walk around the bar and seating areas-there are lots of great Tiki items to check out. Can't wait to go back and try more!

-jR8Yrd3XxtZLfd6gILGGQ.text: We didn't realize what a unique bar this was until our first drinks were delivered with the most beautiful flowers on top. The couple at the table next to ours was drinking from a shallow bowl that was on fire (they had very long straws)...can that be right? We also enjoyed the tacos that were on the menu. Lots of great flavor and just the perfect accompaniment to the fancy drinks. Wish I lived closer so that I could go back to try the drink that is delivered in the golden fish and also to have my favorite again, the Oka Kope Kooler.

NqppHZgeRqBqDgVu24iQXQ.text: Came here twice for drinks with friends. I love this place because there is no where else like it. The atmosphere is so fun and the drinks are delicious and creative. I love that they have drinks to share and everything comes in a cup that has character. The second time I tried the nachos and they were not that special. I would like to go back and try the poke bowl because the couple sitting next to us had one and it looked like they really enjoyed it. Each time it has been a weeknight and not overly busy. I have always been able to get a seat.

PRj4ebfgPa4NeHA_y5YB0Q.text: Went here for happy hour with a friend and was not disappointed. It's a tiki bar and he decor is tropical and fun. We sat at a cute little cocktail style table with a stool and bench and the table was small but it worked. We ordered food so our table space was a little crowded. I got the mofongo and it was delicious and filling. The drinks are to die for. Happy hour is from 5-6 and it's half off some of their house specials, about 6-10 options. Will definitely be returning!

qsgbcLomkLH-8Y6kDhiTAw.text: Wow. This is one hell of an impressive place  The king ku is outstanding as is the shark drink.   They have a new food menu but nothing caught my eye.  I wish they had a bigger app menu   The staff are helpful and nice  The drinks are spellbinding   Pittsburgh is lucky to have this

y0h06ePSLyGsnECDN67gGw.text: Went here for drinks last night. One catch, I'm pregnant. Most places have no idea what to do when you ask them for a mock-cocktail menu but Hidden Harbor lets you have any of their cocktails without the booze. I tried the pain killer. It was really good and quite fancy looking. A lot of the people in my party had food and really liked it. The ambiance was great. Loved the tiki men everywhere. I thought the cocktails were a little pricey but honestly most places are that same price now - about 10-12$. Would come here again post baby.

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Pain killer sans booze

gUDd9iNxFeVWgfVMv40X1w.text: My friend recently had a birthday, and was able to get a reservation here same day, which was great! I was excited to go, since I had been wanting to try this place for awhile. The space is warm and inviting, and does make you feel like you are in a tropical bar (even when it is only 20 degrees out!). We had a corner space at the front, with a comfy couch and ottomans with a central coffee table for our drinks. My friend brought a cake from the Oakmont Bakery, and the staff didn't mind at all and even provided plates and utensils.   The cocktail menu is extensive and unique with a lot of island-themed drinks. My friends' drinks arrived in large shells illuminated red with some kind of waterproof light (nice touch). Since I am allergic to pineapple I went to the bar and ordered a custom drink, requesting Amaro with a slightly sweet mixer. The drink came out and I was told it had rye whiskey. Since I do enjoy a good rye I didn't mind, but I would have liked the drink I actually requested (and I didn't feel like being "that person" who returns her drink repeatedly). Since it was tasty I didn't mind, and simply ordered straight amaro on the rocks for my next drink.   We stayed for a few hours, and enjoyed the evening. The noise level is adequate and the service quick, so it is a great place for a night out with friends. But I think that I will stick to Bar Marco or Meat and Potatoes for a quality cocktail.

-Bpxya7H8bHO808Hi4v1PA.text: I'm not sure what the others had that could justify the five stars. Drink was good but food was meh, not much of it and expensive for what you get. Go for the drink, skip the food

vZFW9d2e1799oUv5hxL-jQ.text: I'm in love with this place!!! The decor is awesome!! It's such a unique little spot nestled in the area. We got the shark drink which was delicious and super cute! They had a couple tables outside which was nice to sit at.

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

kGRRnJFtGsLGK0TeEH0ciA.text: I've been wanting to try this place for awhile but I'm never in Squirrel Hill when they're open. I've been to Hawaii a couple times and love some of their popular dishes, so there are definitely some things on their menu I still have to try (particularly the Poke). I went for happy hour tonight and ordered the Painkiller, Mai Tai and Avocado Nachos with curry steak. The nachos were tasty and the drinks were amazing. I'm not particularly crazy about overly-sweet drinks so I normally wouldn't order this style at a regular restaurant I went out to. These were a perfect blend of hand-crafted, fresh ingredients and I want to try all of them. This was definitely on-par with other high-end Tiki bars I've been to such as Three Dots & a Dash (Chicago) and Porco Tiki Lounge (Cleveland). Will absolutely be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Painkiller

T4iXmfFuz8gcPaBmkTF6_w.text: Looking to slip away to a quiet little tropical isle where colors of the sunset and cool, cool rum drinks surround? You won't have to board ship or plane to escape the mundane anymore, because there's a hidden harbor of tropical delights awaiting. In Squirrel Hill. What?!   This lovely little spot is called Hidden Harbor, a place sure to make all your tiki and tropical dreams come True with well crafted tiki and tropical cocktails and themed small bites that whisk you away to an island vacation, if only in your mind.  A collection of top tiki bartenders (tikitenders?) create cocktails using the best of the best liquors and fresh ingredients. Wes, Max, and Greta (and sometimes Adam) shake up drinks like the Tropic Thunder, Fashionola Fizz, and the signature Hidden Harbor, to name just a few. Then there are the tiki drinks for 2 or 4...fun to share with friends for sure!  The kitchen was kind enough to adapt the pulled pork sliders for my gluten free needs by turning them into mini tacos on corn tortillas instead of the standard bun. Yum. You're gonna love these! My dining companion really enjoyed the sweet and smoky Chicken and Bacon Meatballs. Also on the menu are veggie tacos, ahi tuna tacos...and a selection of other tasty small bites.  Despite the name, Hidden Harbor isn't hard to find at all, it's right next door to The Independent Brewing Company on Shady Avenue. (In fact, both establishments share the same ownership.) Make a point of searching out this "Hidden" gem of a "Harbor" the next time you find yourself in need of a quick mental vacation AND a damned good drink. Ahhhhhhhhhhh......

Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Not the chef&#39;s table, the bartenders&#39; table. What a view!

qaW7XZJuyiykLUxxlBzu4g.text: Came here on a Saturday evening because I love a good tiki bar.  The decor was great and the drink menu even better.  The pricing was pretty standard and the selection abundant.  They have something for everyone taste.  We got the Crab Rangoon nachos and wow were they good!  I'll be back for happy hour next time!

FhavChY0eWJpEiXX8rQW2g.text: Fun, Lively and Themed.  Place: Tiki Bar!  It's cozy, yet big enough to have your own space & not feel crowed.  Atmosphere: Mixed for a Friday around happy hour( age-wise), seating is bar, high top tables, booths/bench, with a few other tables.   Drinks: HUGE rum variety, daiquiris/manhattan (can be created with any spirit), flights, mixed cocktails - in the cutest themed and decorated cups - well done.  Drinks $8-15.  Service: Server was friendly and helpful.   Snacks: Had the vegan and chicken taco  - slightly underwhelming - Nah. Not a dinner place.  Overall: I would return again for drinks and atmosphere - try some other Rums.  I love a place that provides an experience and felt this place did a pretty good job!

Hgx4BszUw_7jVMFWCsGkUA.text: We came here on a Saturday night around 8.30pm and the place was quite packed. We wanted to have a table for 3 and the receptionist told us it would be probably an hour until we would get seated. We were willing to wait at the bar and start with a cocktail. Surprisingly we got seated after only 30 min.  The place has a quite laid back, hipster vibe to it, which I really liked. The music was not too loud, so it was easy to have conversations without screaming at each other. The staff was super friendly, knowledgeable and fun.  Throughout the night we ordered pretty much every cocktail they have on the menu and none of them was a let down. From the presentation to taste to size, it was perfect! I very much enjoyed the Kokomo and the Fizz. All the flavor combinations were wonderful. Nothing too sweet and no flavor was overpowering.  Food wise we had the seared tuna, the pork sliders and the meatballs. I wasn't the biggest fan of their tuna, as it just tasted like cumin, and the rest of the dish such as the falafel croutins and the sauce did not really add anything to the dish, but I did enjoy the pork sliders and meatballs.  The music was a bit hit and miss, didn't really feel like you're actually at a tiki bar, they played music from the 80s to hip hop to pop, and everything in between.   All in all, I'll definitely recommend this place for an after work wind-down with friends. The drinks and staff are amazing!

8L7yvS7V3PAFcy5yeo056w.text: Great drinks and friendly service! Loved the shark drink. We sat outside which was lovely and we still got good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

Y_T0uyRyg6ONVwABFsXtDw.text: This place is so cute! The drinks are a bit pricey, but you're getting a delicious craft cocktail - so it's worth it IMO. The decor is cute and island-y. The food looked delicious but I didn't try anything aside from drinks. Service was quick and pleasant although they were packed!   Definitely would come back to explore the menu a bit more!

nZ08JuI0Ca7y71oQo35p0w.text: Really cool place! A little hard to find at first but once we did, we were happy! We came after a birthday dinner for some drinks! They seated our large group in the corner booth in the front. It was perfect for us all! The atmosphere is cool and inviting. The theme is well established around the place. We all ordered our drinks and they were fun! They come in different fun looking glasses with umbrellas and more! The crab nachos were really good. Good atmosphere for groups! We will be back.

7LFLqPyywD7T2YGUB0NNZQ.text: We went here for dinner early on a Saturday (around 5:30).  I will say that I wasn't impressed with the food (the menu is tiny, and the flavor wasn't anything to write home about), but they aren't really known for that.  It is, after all, a tiki bar, and the cocktails are what they specialize in.  We went to a special event here over the summer for Wigle Whiskey and that's how we learned about their amazing rum collection and tiki drink menu.  The drinks were fantastic and they had a really fun selection.  I've been into cocktails that use coffee flavor-bases, and they had a few of those.  Highly recommended.  My only gripe would be that the seating in the dining area wasn't very comfortable (low, no backs) so I couldn't see myself relaxing there for a long period of time, but other than that we had a great experience.

ZjMWZwX9DMrt4YXNT7VVyw.text: This place is a must try on the pittsburgh cocktail scene! Also makes the best mock tails for those DDs out there!  We were so excited to see what would open next to the already popular IBC. This place does not disappoint for a hopping cocktail place!  Walking in this place has great tiki ambiance, a nice amount of space between bench seating the bar and individual tables. We came with a group and loved sitting in their big booths.  We tried the tropic thunder- excellent drink which delivered with a ton of tropical and fruity yumminess.  I was DD and had the BEST MOCKTAIL EVER. I asked the waitress to have the bartender make whatever he wanted and she came back with a beautiful passion fruit creation that was dolled up with hibiscus flowers and a real cinnamon stick. Best part- it was only $4 and easily one of the most delicious perfectly sweet cocktails (mock or not) I've had in the last year!  Music was also very catchy and fun vibe.  service was attentive and excellent.  I must return and will! Can't wait to show my friends this place and try their food.

photos.caption: Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Amazing passion fruit MOCKTAIL with the drink menu
Photo of Hidden Harbor - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tropic thunder!

9pZr1qdheFp3kfVqmORXqQ.text: On our way to the Squirrel Hill night market decided to grab some appetizers and drinks.  My wife does not like rum drinks and the waiter kept trying to get her to order on saying it was "light" on rum.  Regardless she ended up with an awesome Puerto Escondido (tequila, jalapeno, etc) and I had the gardenia grog.  Both were awesome.  Tuna ceviche and mofongo were great too.  We'll be back

T2IO-p6Wp0z15U7x1_rBhA.text: Such a cool place to go for drinks. Immediately upon walking in, I was amazed at the ambiance and tactful decorations. Despite the cool temps outside, it felt like I was in Hawaii. I ordered a drink with ginger beer in it (can't remember the name) that I did not particularly care for, although it was made well and garnished favorably.  We shared pork sliders and chicken tacos during happy hour. The sliders had a sweeter bread and sauce on the pork was good, but I didn't care for the combo of the bread with the pork as much as I thought I would. Too sweet isn't good, especially with Caribbean food. The chicken tacos were a 'hair' dry, but contained a mango salsa of some sort, which added flavor and consistency. The chicken tasted smokey and was seasoned well. The bathrooms were clean and spacious, and easy to find.   Dropped a few stars due to the variety of drinks not being totally to my liking. I'm more of a berry drink person or coconut and actually do not care for lime. It was hard to find a drink with no lime on the menu and they also didn't have many fruity options that weren't frozen. I also thought our bill was a little high- got 2 drinks and 2 apps during happy hour and our bill was $30.   Overall, amazing atmosphere, good service, and great place to come with friends, but not the cheapest around. If you're looking to save a penny, maybe catch the happy hour, instead! (HH special: 3-4 drink options for $6 and select apps for $6).

AC54eiBOaF2CAUTtE0NcHg.text: Great Tiki bar/lounge... Very upscale and the drinks were very intricate and detailed.. I had the hidden harbor and the tropic thunder... The place is pricey so don't be cheap... Delicious, I recommend the hidden harbor it's there signature drink and is great.

8kNfKYeQyhJEbaOabmWqEw.text: What a fun place! The drinks are tiki classics; new riffs on classics; and all-around amazing and fun. But don't think you can't get a Manhattan or Old Fashioned here because you can. The bartenders are serious professionals who absolutely know what they're doing. They've got quality ingredients (and ONLY quality ingredients. Don't bother asking for Watermelon Pucker or Bud Light). All juices are squeezed fresh daily, all syrups are made in house. There's an awesome collection of high-end rums for sipping like brandy.  And if you really don't want a tiki drink, have a "Leaf and Bean." There's rye whiskey in it, with a cinnamon stick that's set on fire (and then extinguishes like incense) to add a smoky aroma to your drink. This drink belongs in ANY bar, tiki or not.  They have a rum "passport" available where, if you try about 20 (don't quote me) specific rums from 20 locales and get your passport stamped for each, you become a member of the Dead Parrot Society with a cool reward.  This is a wonderful stop on a hot summer night but just as much so on a cold winter's eve.
